title: The Fondation Cartier unveils its new landmark in central Paris
subhed: The Fondation Cartier for Contemporary Art has moved to Place du Palais-Royal in Paris. Like its previous location on Boulevard Raspail, the new building was designed by architect Jean Nouvel, conceived as an innovative, flexible space that can be configured in countless ways.

title: First loves: '20 years later, our bodies recognize each other, it's crazy'
subhed: They met, fell in love and then parted ways. Life's twists and turns eventually brought them back together. Marion, 40, shares her story with Ewen, 43, who will give his version of their reunion in the next installment.

title: 'The Thiaroye massacre in Senegal in 1944 marked the reestablishment of colonial order'
subhed: Mamadou Diouf, historian and president of the committee tasked with investigating the killing by France of African tirailleurs, places this event within African memory in an interview with Le Monde, and laments the difficulty of accessing French archives.

title: Sarkozy imprisonment: Protection of ex-president by armed officers angers prison guards
byline: By Antoine Albertini, Grégoire Biseau and Soren Seelow
subhed: On Wednesday, interior minister Laurent Nuñez defended the measure, citing Nicolas Sarkozy's 'status' and 'threats against him.' Prison guard unions decried it as 'security madness' and 'unprecedented humiliation.'

title: Three years after taking power in Italy, Meloni is dropping the mask
subhed: Appointed in October 2022, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has reassured Brussels and financial markets, notably by reducing the public deficit. But behind this conciliatory image lies a far-right leader who has drawn ever closer to Donald Trump, even going so far as to imitate him on the domestic stage.
